Average Specified Column Groups in a Count Matrix

average_cols.Rd

This function computes the row-wise average of specified groups of columns from a count matrix. It returns a new data frame with averaged values and retains the original row names (typically gene names).

Usage

average_cols(tmm, pairs)

Arguments

tmm

A numeric matrix or data frame with row names representing genes and columns representing samples.

pairs

A list where each element is a character vector of column names in tmm that should be averaged together.

Value

A data frame with the same row names as tmm and one column per element in pairs. Each column contains the average of the corresponding columns from tmm.

Details

The function loops over each group specified in pairs, computes the row-wise mean (ignoring NA values), and assigns a new column name by concatenating the first two elements of the pair using the format "col1_n_col2". This is useful when you want to simplify and summarize data from replicated samples prior to visualization, such as in a heatmap.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Assume tmm is your count matrix and you have defined column groups to average:
pairs <- list(c("counts_RS1050_1_KIDNEY", "counts_RS1316_3_SPLEEN"),
              c("counts_RS1050_1_PB", "counts_RS1316_2_PB"),
              c("counts_RS1316_1_BM", "counts_RS9737_2_BM"))
averaged_tmm <- average_cols(tmm, pairs)
} # }
